title: L glyphs
content:
Typodermic's Hedgrow

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/hedgerow/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014013915/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/hedgerow/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/hedgerow/")

has a nice glyphs where lower case letters sit in the space just above the upper case L's arm. Is there a name for that sort of thing? Are there other typefaces with this kind of glyph built in?
author: snowy

comments.content:
[Ed Interlock!!](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014013915/http:/www.houseind.com/fonts/edbenguiatfonts/viewfonts) And yes, this font deserves those two exclamation points.

From a typographic point of view, it's just another ligature -- an aesthetically pleasing variant of two or more characters, designed by the font designer him/herself.
